thread.title: Tourism minister from Seychelles invited to visit Knesset in Israel
thread.title_full: Tourism minister from Seychelles invited to visit Knesset in Israel

author: eTN Editor
title: Tourism minister from Seychelles invited to visit Knesset in Israel
text:
Tourism minister from Seychelles invited to visit Knesset in Israel Adv: 
Aug 02, 2015 Adv: 
Minister Alain St.Ange, the Seychelles Minister responsible for Tourism and Culture, who was on a working visit to the state of Israel, was invited to visit the parliament of Israel, the Knesset, as it was in session. 
Minister St.Ange was being accompanied during the visit by Noa Furman, the Director of the Africa Department 1 - East Africa at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Israel; Arie Goldstein, the Seychelles Honorary Consul in Israel; and Rosemarie Hoareau, the Director of Marketing at the Seychelles Tourism Board. 
After a comprehensive tour of the Knesset Building, Minister St.Ange and his delegation, accompanied by Noa Furman from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Israel, entered the House at the Knesset to see their parliament in session. 
Minister Alain St.Ange said that he appreciated this visit at the Knesset and enjoyed the parliamentary debate that he was able to witness. "I felt privileged to have been invited to visit the Knesset and to see the House in session. The diversity in the composition of the House was very interesting," said the Seychelles Minister. 
Seychelles is a founding member of the International Coalition of Tourism Partners (ICTP) . Source: Seychelles Ministry of Tourism and Culture
